articles.title: 5 foods that can lower cancer risk
articles.description: Discover five scientifically supported foods that can help reduce your risk of cancer, including broccoli, berries, carrots, whole grains, and olive oil. Eating a balanced diet rich in these nutrient-dense foods can play a significant role in cancer prevention.
articles.content: According to the World Health Organization, cancer is a leading cause of death globally. However, incorporating nutrient-dense foods into your diet can significantly reduce cancer risk. Broccoli, berries, carrots, whole grains, and olive oil are high... [3313 chars]

articles.title: Trump does not intend to sign joint G7 statement on Iran
articles.description: President Donald Trump does not intend to sign a joint statement calling for de-escalation between Israel and Iran that had been drafted by G7 leaders in Canada, according to a person familiar with the matter, though officials preparing the document held out hope that he could eventually be convinced to add his name.
articles.content:

articles.title: Break-in suspect facing murder charge after man's body found, police say
articles.description: A 30-year-old woman arrested and hospitalised following a break-in in Adelaide's east is expected to be charged with the murder of a 65-year-old man whose body was found at a nearby unit, police say.
articles.content:
A woman arrested over a break-in in Adelaide's east is expected to be charged with the murder of a 65-year-old man whose body was found at a nearby unit, police say.

articles.title: Gorge Canada Day Picnic set to celebrate 25 years with expanded line-up
articles.description: The Gorge Canada Day Picnic returns with a full day of festivities along the Gorge Waterway to mark a quarter-century of community spirit.
articles.content:
One of Greater Victoria’s most beloved Canada Day traditions is turning 25.
The Gorge Canada Day Picnic returns Tuesday, July 1, with a full day of free festivities along the Gorge Waterway to mark a quarter-century of community spirit.

articles.title: Tip shop makes change after parents address sale of kids' disability equipment
articles.description: When Bridget Lockley and her partner saw their local tip shop selling a bike for children with special needs, what could have been an opportunity instead left them outraged.
articles.content:
